sources.title: "Back Fire" (1922) starring Jack Hoxie
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "Back Fire" is a Western. The film is included in our program to illustrate the work of Jack Hoxie, a star of Silent Hall of Fame. Two men are mistakenly accused of robbery and murder. One of them is in jail awaiting to be hanged, and the other one tries against the clock to prove their innocence.   Directed by                          Alvin J. Neitz Produced by                        Sunset Productions Scenario by                          Alvin J. Neitz Cinematography                unknown Starring                                Jack Hoxie, Lew Meehan, William Gould, Florence Gilbert Distributed by                     Aywon Film Corporation Release date                         November 1, 1922 Running time                       57 min. Country                                United States Language                              Silent, English intertitles   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: Two cowboys drift into town. Both are broke, and one of them jokingly suggests they rob the local express office. A citizen overhears them, and when the office is robbed soon afterwards, the cowboys are blamed for it.
metadata.Actors: Jack Hoxie, Florence Gilbert, Lew Meehan
